com.cubeia.firebase.api.login.jdbc
Class JDBCLoginHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.cubeia.firebase.api.login.jdbc.JDBCLoginHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
LoginHandler
public class JDBCLoginHandler
extends Object
implements LoginHandler

This login handler uses a table and username and password columns to check a login name and password. It uses exact string matching. Sub-classes may override the createStatement(Connection con) method to supply specialized SQL.

The statement created in createStatement(Connection con) should use the username as parameter 1 and password as parameter 2, and it should select the user id as an int only.

Author:
Larsan

Method Detail

handle

public LoginResponseAction handle(LoginRequestAction request)
Specified by:
handle in interface LoginHandler

createStatement

protected PreparedStatement createStatement(Connection con)
                                     throws SQLException
Create a string query to use in order to check for a user and password with the username as parameter 1 and password as parameter 2. The query should return a unique result if the user can be found with the correct password and select the user id as an inte only. The basic implementation of this method returns: 
                select  from  where  = ? and  = ?;

Parameters:
con - Connection to create statement for, never null
Throws:
SQLException

getNotFoundErrorMessage

protected String getNotFoundErrorMessage()
This method should return the message to send back if the sql query does not get any results. Default msg is "User not found."

Returns:
The "user not found" error message, may be null

getNotFoundErrorCode

protected int getNotFoundErrorCode()
This method should return the error code to send back if the sql query does not get any results. Default msg is 0.

Returns:
The "user not found" error code

getSystemErrorCode

protected int getSystemErrorCode(SQLException e)
This method should return the error code to send back if the sql query fails. Default msg is 0.

Parameters:
e - The sql exception, never null
Returns:
The system error code

getSystemErrorMessage

protected String getSystemErrorMessage(SQLException e)
This method should return the error message to send back if the sql query fails. Default msg is "System error."

Parameters:
e - The sql exception, never null
Returns:
The system error message
